concise_definition: adj. 被迫的, 强制的; v. 强迫 (force 的过去式和过去分词)

definitions.explanation_en: Done under pressure or compulsion, not willingly or naturally; lacking genuine choice or consent.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在压力或强制下完成的，非出于自愿或自然；缺乏真正的选择或同意。
definitions.example_en: She gave a forced smile, though she was deeply upset.
definitions.example_cn: 她勉强挤出一个微笑，尽管内心非常难过。

definitions.explanation_en: Not natural or authentic; artificially created or imposed, often resulting in awkwardness or lack of sincerity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 不自然或不真实的；人为制造或强加的，常导致生硬或缺乏真诚。
definitions.example_en: The dialogue in the movie felt forced and unrealistic.
definitions.example_cn: 这部电影中的对话显得生硬且不真实。

definitions.explanation_en: To make someone do something against their will, using physical, emotional, or authoritative pressure.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使用身体、情感或权威上的压力，迫使某人做违背其意愿的事情。
definitions.example_en: They forced him to sign the contract under threat of imprisonment.
definitions.example_cn: 他们以监禁相威胁，强迫他签署了合同。

comparison.analysis: “Compelled” (被迫) 与 “forced” 非常接近，但语气更正式，常用于法律、道德或心理层面的驱使，强调内在或外在义务的约束，而非直接暴力或威胁。例如：He was compelled by conscience to speak up。而 “forced” 更常指外力直接施加的压迫。
“Coerced” (胁迫) 通常指通过威胁、恐吓或非法手段迫使他人行动，具有更强的非法性和恶意色彩，多用于法律语境。例如：The witness was coerced into lying。而 “forced” 适用范围更广，可包括非违法的强制，如家庭或社会压力。
“Obliged” (有义务) 指因责任、道德或社会规范而感到必须做某事，通常不带有负面或暴力色彩，甚至可能隐含感激。例如：I’m obliged to thank you for your help。而 “forced” 暗示抗拒和不情愿，情感色彩更消极。
